page.title: 12COMMUNICATIONS IN LANDRAKE
page.content: Landrake has developed on both sides of the A38 Trunk Road, one of the two major routeways into Cornwall. During the summer it is very busy,especially on Saturdays when a traffic tailback from the Tamar Road Bridge through Landrake is expected. Each day there are 5 Western National buses to Plymouth and 3 returning. Post is delivered daily by a postman in the mornings.Collections are made from the postbox outside the shop twice a day.The St.Germans doctors hold a surgery in the Village Hall on Fridays and should any prescribed medicines be required,these are sent to Landrake with the postman when he collects the mail. Draft plans are in existence to re-route the A38 thus by-passing Landrake before the end of the century.
